title: Abdellatif Salef
text:
Abdellatif Salef is a Moroccan <a href="association%20football">football</a> manager, who was most recently manager of <a href="Somalia%20national%20football%20team">Somalia</a>.
Managerial career.
In October 2012, Salef replaced <a href="Michel%20De%20Wolf">Michel De Wolf</a> as manager of Belgian club <a href="BX%20Brussels">Bleid-Gaume</a>, before being replaced by De Wolf as manager just a month later.
On 26 May 2021, the <a href="Somali%20Football%20Federation">Somali Football Federation</a> announced the appointment of Salef as manager of <a href="Somalia%20national%20football%20team">Somalia</a> on a two-year contract. On 15 June 2021, hours before Somalia were due to play <a href="Djibouti%20national%20football%20team">Djibouti</a> in a friendly, Salef was sacked from his position after less than three weeks, with the Somali Football Federation labelling him “incompetent” and “undisciplined”.
